name: dependency
content:
dependency noun
(NEED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ S or U ] a situation in which you need something or someone and are unable to continue normally without them: Some parents infantilize young adults and keep them in a permanent state of dependency. We need to reduce our dependency on fossil fuels. Synonym
dependence
[ C or U ] an inability to stop doing something harmful, or using something harmful, especially a drug: Many of the people who come to the clinic have drug or alcohol dependencies. He wrote a memoir about his struggles with chemical dependency. Synonym
addiction
More examplesFewer examplesHe deplores what he regards as an excessive dependency on government.Dependency on petroleum is at the heart of many of our problems today.How much of an issue is benefits dependency?She treats a range of compulsive dependencies, such as alcohol, drugs, sex, gambling and shopping.

dependency noun
(COUNTRY)

More examplesFewer examplesThe Channel Islands and the Isle of Man are Crown dependencies.The Baltic states were former Soviet dependencies.Monaco is a French dependency.
